title: Google\Cloud\Container\V1\SecurityBulletinEvent
name: SecurityBulletinEvent
description:
SecurityBulletinEvent is a notification sent to customers when a security bulletin has been posted that they are vulnerable to.

Generated from protobuf message google.container.v1.SecurityBulletinEvent

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.resource_type_affected
params.description: The resource type (node/control plane) that has the vulnerability. Multiple notifications (1 notification per resource type) will be sent for a vulnerability that affects > 1 resource type.

params.name: data.bulletin_id
params.description: The ID of the bulletin corresponding to the vulnerability.

params.name: data.cve_ids
params.description: The CVEs associated with this bulletin.

params.name: data.severity
params.description: The severity of this bulletin as it relates to GKE.

params.name: data.bulletin_uri
params.description: The URI link to the bulletin on the website for more information.

params.name: data.brief_description
params.description: A brief description of the bulletin. See the bulletin pointed to by the bulletin_uri field for an expanded description.

params.name: data.affected_supported_minors
params.description: The GKE minor versions affected by this vulnerability.

params.name: data.patched_versions
params.description: The GKE versions where this vulnerability is patched.

params.name: data.suggested_upgrade_target
params.description: This represents a version selected from the patched_versions field that the cluster receiving this notification should most likely want to upgrade to based on its current version. Note that if this notification is being received by a given cluster, it means that this version is currently available as an upgrade target in that cluster's location.

params.name: data.manual_steps_required
params.description: If this field is specified, it means there are manual steps that the user must take to make their clusters safe.

methods.name: getSuggestedUpgradeTarget
methods.description:
This represents a version selected from the patched_versions field that the cluster receiving this notification should most likely want to upgrade to based on its current version. Note that if this notification is being received by a given cluster, it means that this version is currently available as an upgrade target in that cluster's location.
